title: INSIDE: a minimal yet bold sex shop devoid of clichés in kyiv
description: sleek surfaces, sensual lighting, and playful touches characterize this intimate concept to to remove stigma around such spaces. The post INSIDE: a minimal yet bold sex shop devoid of clichés in kyiv appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
author: SH
excerpt: sofiia hupalovska and nataliya stukonog's chic sex shop in kyiv diverges from stereotypes of adult retail spaces.
text: sofiia hupalovska and nataliya stukonog complete insideSofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog have created a chic sex shop in Kyiv that diverges from stereotypes of adult retail spaces. Instead of the usual neon lights and clichéd symbols, the Ukrainian designers introduce a more nuanced approach to such environments. One that feels more natural and approachable. ‘INSIDE is not just a sex shop — it’s an immersive experience where design meets passion,’ they share.A sense of intimacy is spatially fostered by tucking the showroom within a basement space, transforming it into an exploratory environment that encourages curiosity and openness, removing any sense of stigma. Bold architectural choices, sensual lighting, and a playfully sophisticated ambiance characterize the concept, emphasizing a blend of sleek and textured finishes for a tactile finish that feels luxurious yet accessible.all images by Yevhenii Avramenkosleek surfaces, sensual lighting, and an accessible ambianceSituated underground with no access to natural light, INSIDE incorporates a stretch ceiling with backlighting. This setup creates a soft diffused glow that mimics daylight, eliminating harsh shadows and making the space feel more open and airy. The lighting design enhances the showroom’s clean aesthetic, ensuring that every detail — from product displays to architectural elements — is clearly illuminated. In the reception area, intended to feel both private and welcoming, the designers have positioned the desk against a striking metallic backdrop. Soft lighting enhances this central greeting point, while the desk itself establishes a clear check-in or information zone without overwhelming the rest of the store. Ahead, the seating area features a sofa with organic curves as an artistic representation of the human form. The placement of ‘LOVE CARE PLEASURE’ messaging on the walls beside it reinforces the store’s philosophy with boldness.Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog designed the shelving as rounded built-in wall units that respond to the curvature of the basement walls and provide a clean backdrop for showcasing products. They ensure easy accessibility while browsing, keeping the space uncluttered. The depth of the shelves and the spacing are also specifically planned for product categories, making it easy for customers to navigate different items. The softly rounded counter located within the main display area functions as a focal point and a customer service station, and facilitates the flow of movement around the space, guiding visitors naturally toward various sections and product displays.Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog have created a chic sex shop in KyivSofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog incorporate neutral shades of cream, gray, and metallics to create an upscale yet understated backdrop for the products. Reflective metallic surfaces amplify the lighting effect, while fabric elements, such as curtains, introduce softer textures for contrast. Custom furniture produced by Ukrainian contractors maintains the minimalist theme with rounded, organic forms. INSIDE’s playful yet elegant character is further emphasized by select design features, including a central pouf shaped like a phallic form, adding a bold and humorous touch.the concept diverges from stereotypes of adult retail spaces‘an immersive experience where design meets passion’the welcome desk is positioned against a striking metallic backdropsensual lighting seeps throughneutral shades of cream, gray, and metallics create an upscale yet understated backdropa central pouf shaped like a phallic form adds a bold and humorous toucha sofa with organic curves is an artistic representation of the human formproject info:name: INSIDE designer: Sofiia Hupalovska, Nataliya Stukonoglocation: Kyiv, Ukrainedesignboom has received this project from our DIY submissions feature, where we welcome our readers to submit their own work for publication. see more project submissions from our readers here.edited by: ravail khan | designboom
html:
sofiia hupalovska and nataliya stukonog complete inside

Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog have created a chic sex shop in Kyiv that diverges from stereotypes of adult retail spaces. Instead of the usual neon lights and clichéd symbols, the Ukrainian designers introduce a more nuanced approach to such environments. One that feels more natural and approachable. ‘INSIDE is not just a sex shop — it’s an immersive experience where design meets passion,’ they share.

A sense of intimacy is spatially fostered by tucking the showroom within a basement space, transforming it into an exploratory environment that encourages curiosity and openness, removing any sense of stigma. Bold architectural choices, sensual lighting, and a playfully sophisticated ambiance characterize the concept, emphasizing a blend of sleek and textured finishes for a tactile finish that feels luxurious yet accessible.


all images by Yevhenii Avramenko

sleek surfaces, sensual lighting, and an accessible ambiance

Situated underground with no access to natural light, INSIDE incorporates a stretch ceiling with backlighting. This setup creates a soft diffused glow that mimics daylight, eliminating harsh shadows and making the space feel more open and airy. The lighting design enhances the showroom’s clean aesthetic, ensuring that every detail — from product displays to architectural elements — is clearly illuminated. In the reception area, intended to feel both private and welcoming, the designers have positioned the desk against a striking metallic backdrop. Soft lighting enhances this central greeting point, while the desk itself establishes a clear check-in or information zone without overwhelming the rest of the store. Ahead, the seating area features a sofa with organic curves as an artistic representation of the human form. The placement of ‘LOVE CARE PLEASURE’ messaging on the walls beside it reinforces the store’s philosophy with boldness.

Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog designed the shelving as rounded built-in wall units that respond to the curvature of the basement walls and provide a clean backdrop for showcasing products. They ensure easy accessibility while browsing, keeping the space uncluttered. The depth of the shelves and the spacing are also specifically planned for product categories, making it easy for customers to navigate different items. The softly rounded counter located within the main display area functions as a focal point and a customer service station, and facilitates the flow of movement around the space, guiding visitors naturally toward various sections and product displays.


Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog have created a chic sex shop in Kyiv

Sofiia Hupalovska and Nataliya Stukonog incorporate neutral shades of cream, gray, and metallics to create an upscale yet understated backdrop for the products. Reflective metallic surfaces amplify the lighting effect, while fabric elements, such as curtains, introduce softer textures for contrast. Custom furniture produced by Ukrainian contractors maintains the minimalist theme with rounded, organic forms. INSIDE’s playful yet elegant character is further emphasized by select design features, including a central pouf shaped like a phallic form, adding a bold and humorous touch.


the concept diverges from stereotypes of adult retail spaces


‘an immersive experience where design meets passion’


the welcome desk is positioned against a striking metallic backdrop


sensual lighting seeps through


neutral shades of cream, gray, and metallics create an upscale yet understated backdrop


a central pouf shaped like a phallic form adds a bold and humorous touch


a sofa with organic curves is an artistic representation of the human form

name: INSIDE
designer: Sofiia Hupalovska, Nataliya Stukonog

location: Kyiv, Ukraine
